revised_title: Petrology and Tectonic Evolution of Igneous and Metamorphic Rocks from the Mid-Atlantic Ridge
tldr: This article discusses the petrology and tectonic evolution of igneous and metamorphic rocks from the Mid-Atlantic Ridge, focusing on the trace element composition and the implications for sea-floor spreading theory. The authors present data from a study conducted on the crest and east flank of the M.A.R. at 8°S, examining the structural and magmatic evolution of the ridge. They explore the effects of post-eruption processes on trace element data and discuss the potential influence of these processes on the composition of the mantle source and the mechanisms that produce basaltic magma.
